name: Sales Data
title: Sales Data

api_list.name: /warehouseSales
api_list.description: The 'warehouseSales' endpoint in the 'SalesData' API provides a user-friendly way to access a collection of possible values for the 'warehouseSales' field. This field represents the sales figures associated with various warehouses and is returned as an array of strings. Each string in the array represents a unique value for the 'warehouseSales' field. For instance, the endpoint might return values such as '1.00', '3.00', and '13.00', which could indicate the sales amounts in a particular currency format (e.g., dollars). By utilizing this endpoint, developers or users can easily retrieve a comprehensive list of all the available sales value options for the 'warehouseSales' field. This can be helpful for data analysis, filtering, or performing calculations on the sales data within the API, allowing for a more efficient and user-friendly experience.

api_list.name: /itemDescription
api_list.description: The 'itemDescription' endpoint in the 'SalesData' API provides a-friendly way to retrieve a of possible descriptions for items. endpoint returns an array of, indicating the different descriptions that be associated with various items For instance, if you are looking for information about a specific, you can use this endpoint to obtain a variety of wine such as 'CRUZEIRO VINHO VERDE BRANCO - 750ML,' 'WOLFBERGER GEW SILVER MEDAL - 750ML,' or 'ANGELINE RES CHARD - 750ML.' These descriptions help identify the brand, type, and size of the item in question.By accessing the 'itemDescription' endpoint, users can retrieve a comprehensive range of possible descriptions, assisting them in accurately categorizing and identifying different items within their sales data. This information can be valuable in inventory management, sales analysis, and overall business operations.

api_list.name: /dataListIndex
api_list.description: The 'dataListIndex' endpoint from the 'SalesData' API provides a convenient way to retrieve a list of all the possible values for the 'dataListIndex' field. The endpoint returns an array of strings containing these values. The 'dataListIndex' field is an important identifier used in the SalesData system to categorize and organize data. It helps in efficiently managing and searching for specific information related to sales. Each value in the array represents a unique 'dataListIndex' that can be associated with various sales records.By using this endpoint, developers can easily obtain a comprehensive list of all possible 'dataListIndex' values present in the SalesData system. This can be useful for tasks like data analysis, report generation, or integrating the SalesData API with other systems.Note that the example values given (79955, 111025, 227737) are just a few examples out of the many possible 'dataListIndex' values that can be retrieved using this endpoint.

api_list.name: /retailSales
api_list.description: The 'retailSales' endpoint from the 'SalesData' API is a useful feature that allows users to retrieve a collection of strings representing various values for the field 'retailSales'. This field corresponds to the recorded sales data in a retail environment. By accessing this endpoint, users can gather valuable information regarding the retail sales figures.This endpoint provides a comprehensive array of potential values for 'retailSales', giving users a wide range of data points to analyze. These values could include monetary figures such as 10.50, 25.76, or 100.00, representing different amounts of sales recorded in a retail setting. The values returned are not limited to specific ranges or categories, allowing users to explore the full spectrum of retail sales possibilities.By utilizing the 'retailSales' endpoint, users can gain insights into the performance of retail sales over time, identify trends, and make informed decisions based on the data. This feature enhances data analysis capabilities, enabling more effective strategies for managing and improving retail sales performance.

api_list.name: /itemType
api_list.description: The 'itemType' endpoint from the 'SalesData' API provides a list of different types of items that can be found in the sales data. Each item type represents a specific category of products. It returns an array of strings containing all the possible values for the 'itemType' field.This endpoint is useful for analyzing sales data based on different item categories. By retrieving the list of item types, it allows businesses to understand the variety of products sold and categorize them accordingly. This information can be utilized for various purposes such as inventory management, sales reporting, or market analysis.For example, if a business is involved in the retail industry, the 'itemType' endpoint can help them identify the different types of products they sell, including clothing, electronics, accessories, or groceries. This knowledge enables better organization and insights into sales performance for each product category.Overall, the 'itemType' endpoint provides valuable information about the various item types represented in the sales data, assisting businesses in understanding and categorizing their products effectively for data analysis and decision-making.

api_list.name: /retailTransfers
api_list.description: The 'retailTransfers' endpoint from the 'SalesData' API provides a collection of strings representing potential values for the field 'retailTransfers'. This field is related to retail transfers and may hold various numerical values. By utilizing this endpoint, users can retrieve an array of strings that encompass the complete range of potential values for 'retailTransfers'.For instance, if a retail business requires information about possible amounts for retail transfers, they can make use of this endpoint to obtain a comprehensive list of options. The values returned by this endpoint are expressed in a decimal format, such as '0.00' or '5.00'. However, please note that these specific examples are not explicitly mentioned in the description.By accessing the 'retailTransfers' endpoint, users can efficiently gather the complete array of available values for the field, providing them with valuable insights and enabling them to make informed decisions within their retail operations.

api_list.name: /month
api_list.description: The 'month' endpoint in the 'SalesData' API provides a user-friendly array of strings representing all the possible values for the 'month' field. When you make a request to this endpoint, it will return a list of different months, each represented as a string. These strings are used to identify and categorize sales data according to the respective month in which the transactions occurred. For instance, the array may include strings like 'January,' 'February,' 'March,' and so on.This endpoint is particularly helpful for businesses and individuals who want to analyze sales data based on specific months. By utilizing the 'month' endpoint, you can obtain a comprehensive list of all available months in your sales data set. This information can be used for generating reports, visualizations, or gaining insights into seasonal patterns or trends. With the help of the 'month' endpoint, you can effectively explore, filter, and manipulate your sales data based on particular months of interest.

api_list.name: /year
api_list.description: The 'year' endpoint from the 'SalesData' API provides a user-friendly way of accessing a list of all the possible values for the 'year' field. When you make a request to this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings that represent the years available in the sales data. These strings will typically consist of four digits, representing the year in the format YYYY.For example, if you were to access this endpoint, you might receive an array containing values like '2015', '2016', '2018', and so on. These values represent the different years for which sales data is available in the API.This endpoint can be useful when you want to filter or analyze sales data based on specific years. By knowing all the possible values for the 'year' field, you can make informed decisions about which years to include or exclude in your analysis.Overall, the 'year' endpoint simplifies the process of retrieving and managing the available year data from the 'SalesData' API, allowing you to easily retrieve the relevant information you need for your sales analysis or reports.

api_list.name: /records
api_list.description: The 'records' endpoint is the primary gateway to access the wealth of information stored within the 'SalesData' API. This powerful feature enables users to retrieve specific data rows based on their query parameters. By utilizing this endpoint, users can effortlessly extract the precise information they require for their analysis, reporting, or decision-making processes.Upon making a request to the 'records' endpoint, users will receive an array of objects that represent the relevant rows associated with their specified query parameters. These objects contain essential details, such as sales figures, customer information, product details, and other pertinent data points.With the 'records' endpoint at their disposal, users can effectively filter and obtain a customized dataset tailored to their specific needs. Whether it's extracting sales records for a particular time period, analyzing sales data of specific products or regions, or any other criteria, users can effortlessly retrieve the desired information.By leveraging the 'records' endpoint, users can quickly access the insights they need to make informed decisions, identify trends, and optimize their strategies. The endpoint empowers users to unravel valuable patterns and unlock hidden opportunities within their sales data, ultimately driving growth and improving overall business performance.

api_list.name: /supplier
api_list.description: The 'supplier' endpoint in the 'SalesData' API provides a wide range of options available for the field 'supplier'. This endpoint returns an array of strings, where each string represents a possible value for the 'supplier' field. When using this endpoint, you will receive a list of various supplier names that are associated with the products or services offered in the API. These supplier names can include a mix of company names, such as PWSWN INC, KYSELA PERE ET FILS LTD, and THE COUNTRY VINTNER, LLC DBA WINEBOW, among others.By accessing this endpoint, you gain insight into the different suppliers available in the API system, allowing you to identify and select the appropriate supplier for your specific requirements. It provides a user-friendly way to explore the diverse range of suppliers within the SalesData API ecosystem, ensuring that you can effectively navigate and utilize the platform's resources.

api_list.name: /itemCode
api_list.description: The 'itemCode' endpoint in the 'SalesData' API provides a convenient way for users to explore all the available item codes within the system. An item code is a unique identifier assigned to each item or product in the sales data. By accessing this endpoint, you will receive an array of strings that represents all the possible values for the 'itemCode' field.Item codes are typically used to track and manage inventory, allowing businesses to identify specific items quickly and efficiently. This endpoint is useful for various purposes, such as retrieving information related to specific items, generating reports, or analyzing sales trends for particular products.By utilizing the 'itemCode' endpoint, users can gain insights into the range of item codes and determine which codes are currently in use within the system. This information can be further utilized to streamline inventory management, analyze popular products, or monitor sales performance for individual items.
